Abegondo, [[Spain]] | capacity = 3,000 | chairman = {{flagicon|Spain}} [[Augusto CÃ©sar Lendoiro|Augusto Lendoiro]] | manager = {{flagicon|Spain}} Rogelio Ramallo | league = [[Tercera DivisiÃ³n|3Âª - Group 1]] | season = 2010â11 | position = [[Segunda DivisiÃ³n B Groups 1-4|2ÂªB - Group 1]], '''17th''' (relegated) | shirtsupplier= Lotto Sport Italia shirtsponsors= Estrella Galicia pattern_la1=_depor1011h|pattern_b1=_depor1011h|pattern_ra1=_depor1011h | leftarm1=FFFFFF|body1=FFFFFF|rightarm1=FFFFFF|shorts1=0000ff|socks1=0000ff | pattern_la2=_depor1011a|pattern_b2=_depor1011a|pattern_ra2=_depor1011a | leftarm2=FFcF11|body2=FFcF11|rightarm2=FFcF11|shorts2=000000|socks2=000000 | t=s | pattern_la3=_depor1011t|pattern_b3=_depor1011t|pattern_ra3=_depor1011t | leftarm3=663399|body3=663399|rightarm3=663399|shorts3=FFFFFF|socks3=FFFFFF current = 2010â11 Segunda DivisiÃ³n B }} '''Real Club Deportivo de La CoruÃ±a B, S.A.D.''' is a [[List of football clubs in Spain|Spanish football team]] based in [[A CoruÃ±a]], in the autonomous community of [[Galicia (Spain)|Galicia]]. It is the [[reserve team]] of [[Deportivo de La CoruÃ±a]]. Founded in 1964, it currently plays in [[Tercera DivisiÃ³n|Tercera DivisiÃ³n - Group 1]], and holds home games at ''[[El Mundo del FÃºtbol]]'', with a capacity of 3,000 spectators.[http://www.canaldeportivo.com/club/mundo_futbol/ Stadium general info]; Deportivo's official website {{es icon}} ==History== The origins of Deportivo B can be found in 1914, when is ''Fabril Sociedad Deportiva'' is born. In 1964,[http://www.canaldeportivo.com/rcd/revistas/035/P026.pdf Deportivo Juvenil y Fabril, dos equipos distintos (Deportivo Juvenil and Fabril, two different teams)]; Deportivo's official website, 27 February 2008 {{es icon}} Fabril officially became the reserve team of [[Deportivo de La CoruÃ±a]], being thus renamed ''Fabril Deportivo''. In 1994, the team is again renamed, this time as ''Deportivo de La CoruÃ±a B''. It managed to play four consecutive years in the [[Segunda DivisiÃ³n B|third level]] in the mid-90's, and another two in the following decade, but competed mostly in the lower leagues. ==Season to
